intro: Spyridium mucronatum subsp. recurvum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf spyridium, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It features small, oval leaves that are typically narrow and have a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers, which are borne on short pedicels. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests. The subspecies is distinguished by its recurved leaf tips and compact growth habit.
